data.title: Lompoc, CA
data.meta_description: See what it's like to live in Lompoc, CA. Explore reviews and statistics on crime, real estate, and cost of living.
data.text:
I grew up in Vandenberg Village since 1966. Lompoc would be a great community to live in if the POLICE would arrest CRIMINALS. In my opinion, they have the most corrupt court house in the entire nation. The JUDGE who sat on the bench for around 40 years was an alleged alcoholic with numerous DUI'S. Allegedly he would sentence other alcoholics to County jail or prison and then get off work and go to the local bar. If a POLICE officer committed a crime against a private citizen, the POLICE would arrest the private citizen and put them in front of this corrupt judge, no matter what happened to the private citizen he would find them guilty to cover up the alleged corrupt POLICE officers. Many families have left Lompoc and the state because of this CORRUPTION. Maybe as many as 500 to 1000 families. It would be better to have 500 to 1000 more families working and paying taxes then a bunch of criminal or incompetent POLICE officers. LOMPOC P.D, S.B. SHERIFF'S, C.H.P., VAFB SECURITY POLICE BYE

Exploring the Enchantment of Lompoc, California: The Backyard of Santa Barbara

Beautiful Santa Barbara backyard next to the beach and a river nice here. I would like a mall here and to have homeless advocacy here to help to homeless get off the street and give them resources and options. I'm going to start soccer practice soon and for some classes, I would like to have a metro here would be perfect for the blue-collar folk and students at the college.

Nestled in the picturesque landscapes of California, Lompoc emerges as a hidden gem, offering a unique blend of natural beauty, rich history, and a welcoming community. Situated just beyond the boundaries of Santa Barbara, Lompoc serves as the charming backyard of this coastal city.
